title: Daphne
description: Described by Strabo as a village (katoikia) about 40 stadia (~6 km) outside Antioch, Daphne today is known as Harbiye, in Turkey's Hatay province. In ancient times, it was home to a sacred grove and sanctuary of Apollo and Artemis, but today there are no visible monumental structures of ancient date.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 20210

properties.description: Associated modern location based on OpenStreetMap
properties.title: OSM Location of Modern Harbiye, Antakya
